title: SIAS releases Andron Gaeilge – A new typeface for Irish
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Tschild_Andron_Irisch_9-musik_5364.png)

I take the pleasure to announce the release of [Andron-2-Irish](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andreas-stotzner/andron-2-eir-corpus/).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Tschild_Andron_Irisch_2_3476.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Tschild_Andron_Irisch_1_5661.png)

Andron Irish is the youngest child in the ever-growing Andron family. Together with Andron-Latin, Andron-English, Andron-Deutsch, Andron-ABC and other brothers and sisters it forms a unique set of specialized typefaces in a classical style.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Tschild_Andron_Irisch_3_4197.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351im_/http:/typophile.com/files/schild_Andron_Irisch_4_5266.png)

Andron-Irish is a comprehensively furnished suite of 5 fonts. Now you can use Italics, Bold and small caps as with Latin, the usual way. A fancy extra is the middlecase font with uncial glyphs. It follows the proportions of the [Andron MC series](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andreas-stotzner/andron-mc/).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Tschild_Andron_Irisch_6_5582.png)

Opentype features have been implemented to enable the easy use of alternative insular glyphs as well as to switch from modern orthography to the tradional one.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102351im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Tschild_Andron_Irisch_8_6723.png)

Best wishes for St Patrick’s day … !
author: Andreas Stötzner

comments.content: I did not even know there was an Irish script! This is beautiful - love the harp-like A and the many letters that seem to be half Latin and half Arabic. Kudos and good luck.
